snippet: With Mitt Romney’s economic arguments faltering, his team plans to refocus its criticisms on energy, health care, taxes, spending and foreign affairs policies.
abstract: Mitt Romney’s campaign, with his economic arguments faltering, plans to refocus its criticisms on energy, health care, taxes, spending and foreign affairs policies; advisers say he is armed with a litany of arguments for his Oct 3 debate with Pres Obama.

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and ASHLEY PARKER
byline.contributor: Michael Barbaro and Jeremy W. Peters contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: With Mitt Romney’s economic arguments faltering, his team plans to refocus its criticisms on energy, health care, taxes, spending and foreign affairs policies.

headline.seo: Romney Broadens Focus as Economic Argument Sputters
headline.main: Romney Campaign Expands Focus Beyond the Economy
headline.print_headline: Romney Expands Focus Beyond the Economy
